elements.title: Ida Hunt Udall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Latter-day Saint diarist Ida Hunt Udall (pictured) turned down a marriage offer from her longtime boyfriend because he was a monogamist, and she wanted a polygamous marriage?

elements.title: Xinxiu bencao (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Xinxiu bencao was the first state-sponsored pharmacopoeia in China?

elements.title: Jeff Jordan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before playing in the NFL, Jeff Jordan was a Rhodes Scholarship finalist?

elements.title: Japanese fire-bellied newt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Japanese fire-bellied newt has a toxin that blocks sodium channels in most vertebrates?

elements.title: Edward Glemham (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Edward Glemham destroyed two Spanish vessels, repulsed four galleys, and captured a rich Venetian merchant ship in his first voyage as a privateer in 1590?

elements.title: a biography of her husband (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that anthropologist Theodora Kroeber wrote a biography of her husband that was described as a "welcome and refreshing exception" to the "often embarrassing" biographies of men written by their wives?

elements.title: D. M. Thomas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Cornish poet D. M. Thomas blamed himself for the death of William Golding, the author of Lord of the Flies?

elements.title: the Roosevelt Hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Roosevelt Hotel had a Teddy Bear Cave?
